results.title: Brazil Fails to Replace Cuban Doctors, Hurting Health Care of 28 Million
results.abstract: After Cuba recalled 8,517 doctors from Brazil, Jair Bolsonaro, the country’s new president, told Brazilians “we can solve this problem.” So far, he has failed, with millions paying the price.
results.byline: By SHASTA DARLINGTON and LETÍCIA CASADO

results.title: New Zealand Court, Blocking Extradition, Is Latest to Rebuke China’s Judiciary
results.abstract: In a strongly worded ruling, a New Zealand court ordered that human rights risks in China be considered before a murder suspect could be sent there.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

multimedia.caption: A New Zealand court said that before extraditing a murder suspect to China, the justice minister, Andrew Little, had to examine “the extent to which the judiciary is subject to political control.”

results.title: Pakistan’s Tribal Areas Are Still Waiting for Justice as Army Tightens Grip
results.abstract: A year after Pakistan voted to bring the Pashtun tribal areas into the national civilian court system, the army is still the master of justice there, residents say.

results.title: A Win for Gay Rights in Botswana Is a ‘Step Against the Current’ in Africa
results.abstract: Thirty-two of Africa’s 54 nations have laws that criminalize consensual same-sex conduct, according to activists. Change has come, but it is spotty and slow.
des_facet: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

multimedia.caption: Activists leaving the Botswana High Court in Gaborone on Tuesday after the court ruled to decriminalize homosexuality. The court’s decision came about 16 years after a previous attempt to strike down Botswana’s anti-sodomy laws failed.

results.title: China Moves to Close Gap in Trade Expertise as Clash With Trump Intensifies
results.abstract: Beijing called in one of its most experienced negotiators on trade policy shortly before talks with the United States collapsed, adding a veteran voice at a critical moment.

multimedia.caption: Yu Jianhua’s return from his post as China’s ambassador to the United Nations’ offices in Geneva suggests Beijing realizes an expertise gap may be hurting its ability to resolve a potentially devastating trade war with the United States.

results.title: When the World’s Most Famous Mystery Writer Vanished
results.abstract: On a cold December night in 1926, Agatha Christie went out in her beloved Morris Cowley roadster and didn’t return home for 11 days. Here’s how her disappearance played out.

results.title: Dark Web Drug Sellers Dodge Police Crackdowns
results.abstract: The notorious Silk Road site was shut down in 2013. Others have followed. But the online trafficking of illegal narcotics hasn’t abated.
